昼間だから絶対込んでいると思いきや、一人もいなかった。
column2: Despite having thought that it must be crowded since it was afternoon, (surprisingly) not a single person was there.
column4: Using 「思いきや」 to describe something unexpected

#separator:: このレストランは安いと思いきや、会計は5千円以上だった！
column2: Thought this restaurant would be cheap but (surprisingly) the bill was over 5,000 yen!
column4: Using 「思いきや」 to describe something unexpected

#separator:: 散歩がてら、タバコを買いに行きました。
column2: While taking a stroll, I also used that time to buy cigarettes.
column4: Using 「～がてら」 to do two things at one time

#separator:: 博物館を見がてらに、お土産を買うつもりです。
column2: While seeing the museum, I plan to also use that time to buy souvenirs.
column4: Using 「～がてら」 to do two things at one time

#separator:: 事情を2時間かけて説明したあげく、納得してもらえなかった。
column2: (After a great deal of) explaining the circumstances for 2 hours, (in the end), couldn’t receive understanding.
column4: Using 「～あげく（挙句）」 to describe a bad result

#separator:: 先生と相談のあげく、退学をしないことにした。
column2: (After much) consulting with teacher, (in the end), decided on not dropping out of school.
column4: Using 「～あげく（挙句）」 to describe a bad result
